definition: the skilled practice of a practical occupation, to make by hand and with much skill
details:
noun
- the skilled practice of a practical occupation
= synonyms: trade
- a vehicle designed for navigation in or on water or air or through outer space
- shrewdness as demonstrated by being skilled in deception
= synonyms: cunning, guile, craftiness, foxiness, slyness, wiliness
- skill in an occupation or trade
= synonyms: craftsmanship, workmanship
- people who perform a particular kind of skilled work
= example: people who perform a particular kind of skilled work
= synonyms: trade
verb
- to make by hand and with much skill
= example: to make by hand and with much skill
